tutorial.title: Portfolio Website
tutorial.descriptionContent: Create a webpage where you can showcase your favorite coding projects

executableContent.instructions:
Let's build a simplified freelance web designer's portfolio website that would be a great starting point for your own portfolio.

Start off by creating our navigation. 

1. Add a `nav` element inside the `body` element of the webpage.
2. Inside the `nav` element, code a first-level heading with the name `Nina Davidson` or your own name.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
<!doctype html>
<html>
  <body>
  </body>
</html>

files.name: portfolio.html
files.content:
My Previous Work

Here's a list of some of my previous work and satisfied clients.

files.name: contact.html
files.content:
Get in touch

Let's chat about how I can help with your next project.

files.name: 404.html
files.content:
Nina Davidson

404 - Page not found!

That's an oooopppsieee!

executableContent.instructions:
Let's now add a few links to the navigation on our homepage. 

1. Below the heading, add a link to the homepage `index.html` and display the text `Home`.
2. Add a link to the portfolio page `portfolio.html` and display the text `Portfolio`.
3. Add a link to the contact page `contact.html` and display the text `Get in touch`.

files.name: index.html
files.content: Nina Davidson
files.solvedContent:
Nina Davidson

Home Portfolio Get in touch

files.name: portfolio.html
files.content:
My Previous Work

Here's a list of some of my previous work and satisfied clients.

files.content:
Get in touch

Let's chat about how I can help with your next project.

files.content:

404 - Page not found!

That's an oooopppsieee!

hints.title: Hints
hints.content: Create links using the `` tags and specify a target URL using the `href` attribute.

executableContent.instructions:
We have multiple pages on our website, so we need to ensure the navigation is present and consistent on every page.

1. Copy the `nav` element in its entirety from `index.html`.
2. Click the tab titled `portfolio.html` and paste the `nav` in the body, *before* the `div`.
3. Click the tab titled `contact.html` and paste the `nav` in the body, *before* the `div`.

executableContent.instructions:
Now let's go back to our `index.html` page and create a new section to contain some biographical content. 

1. Create a `div` below the navigation.
2. Inside the `div` code a `p` element with some text introducing Nina the freelance web designer (or yourself).
3. Next code an `img` element and set its `src` attribute to `img/nina.png` or a different address if you'd like to add a picture of yourself.
4. Add an additional paragraph element below the image to further introduce Nina (or yourself).

files.name: index.html
files.content:
Nina Davidson

Home Portfolio Get in touch
files.solvedContent:
Nina Davidson

Home Portfolio Get in touch

Hi! I'm Nina and I'm a freelance web designer.

I first learned how to code on an app on my phone a few years ago. Now, I'm coding part-time for a living while working remotely from all around the world.

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Images require the use of the `src` attribute to define the source of the image. If using your own image, be sure to use an absolute path (i.e., one that starts with `http://`).

executableContent.instructions:
It looks like our image might be a bit too big for the scale of our page. Let's add an additional attribute to the image element to help with sizing.

1. Add the `width` attribute to the image element and set it equal to `300`.

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Element attributes always take the form of `attribute="value"`.

executableContent.instructions:
Now, let's add a section to show off your latest project work.

1. Code a new paragraph after the second `p` element and add the text `Check out my latest project!`.
2. Make the last two words of that paragraph a link (be careful not to include the exclamation point).
3. Since we don't yet have a project page to display, set the link to point to our `404.html` page.

_Note: 404 pages are used to let a site's visitors know that they've clicked on a link that leads to a page that can't be found._

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Wrap the words `latest project` in `a` tags. Don't include the "!" in your link.

executableContent.instructions:
Since we just used our 404 page, let's make it a bit more helpful and visually interesting. 

1. After the `h1` element, start by coding a link displaying `Back to homepage` that links to the homepage `index.html`.
2. After the `p` element, add an image element and set its `src` attribute to `img/ghost.png`.
3. Set the image `width` to `300`.
4. After you complete the tasks you can click `latest project` at the bottom of the home page to see the results on the 404 page.

executableContent.instructions:
Let's move on to the portfolio page to add some new content to show off some previous work examples.

1. In `portfolio.html` start by coding an unordered list below the existing paragraph element. 
2. Create three list items within the unordered list element.
3. Within each list item, create an `a` element that links to our `404.html` page and displays some text to describe each work example. You're also free to use your own actual examples and links. If you use your own links make sure to use absolute paths.
5.  After you complete the tasks you can click `Portfolio` at the top of the home page to see the results on the portfolio page.

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
Your code should look something like this:

```HTML
<unordered list>
    <list item>
     Link #1
    </list item>
    <list item>
     Link #2
    </list item>
    <list item>
     Link #3
    </list item>
   </unordered list>
```

executableContent.instructions:
Let's move on to the `contact.html` page to add some form fields. We won't worry about making our form functional for now, we just want to create the basic form using HTML.

1. Below the existing paragraph in `contact.html`, add an `input` element with `type` set to `text` and `placeholder` set to `Name`.
2. Add a second `input` element with `type` set to `email` and `placeholder` set to `Email`.
3.  After you complete the tasks you can click `Get in touch` at the top of the home page to see the results on the contact page.

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Input fields  are created using `<input type="value" placeholder="value">`.

executableContent.instructions:
Next, let's add an option to share the budget of the project.

1. To give the input some context, code a paragraph displaying `Budget` after the second input.
2. To communicate the low end of the range, create some emphasized text containing `$500` under the `Budget` paragraph.
3. To communicate the high end of the range, create some emphasized text containing `$5000+`.
4. Between the two `em` elements you just created, code an `input` field and set the `type` to `range`.
5. After you complete the tasks you can click `Get in touch` at the top of the home page to see the results on the contact page.

executableContent.instructions:
Let's complete our form fields by using the `checkbox` input type to let our users tell us what kind of project they are interested in. 

1. Under the second `em`, add a paragraph displaying `Website type`.
2. Create an `input` element and set the `type` to `checkbox`.
3. Add some emphasized text below the `input` element to show the checkbox is for `Blog`.
4. Repeat steps 2 and 3 to add checkboxes for `Company` and `Other`.
